body:
Here's what I've found about the named color specs:

- **SVG1.1:** For the time being, [this section](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/types.html#ColorKeywords) in the SVG 1.1 spec seems to be the definitive reference for named colors. 

- **CSS4:** If we want to be future proof, the draft CSS4 spec is definitively defining [named colors](http://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-4/#named-colors) extending beyond the SVG1.1 spec.
  
- **CSS3:** In the CSS3 spec named colors are broken into [two](http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#html4) different [sections](http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#svg-color) and the extended color list essentially refers to SVG 1.1 - so probably not a definitive list  

- **SVG2:** For the time being, i'm not able to find a named color spec in the draft SVG2 working group docs similar to SVG1.1. They seem to be adding flexibility in the named color spec 

- **X11: ** The official reference for X11 colors in W3 docs seems to be Wikipedia, so that's probably not a good idea :-) 

I'd say that basing generation of named colors on the draft CSS4 spec will likely give us future compatibility for many years as the draft gets worked on and published. If we want to be strictly published standards driven, then we should follow SVG1.1
